benchmark_details.name: IFEvalCode
benchmark_details.overview: IFEvalCode is a multilingual benchmark designed to evaluate both code correctness and code controllability in LLM-generated code, comprising 1.6K samples across 8 programming languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the capability of generating controlled code that adheres to human requirements and instructions across multiple programming languages.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The current coverage of eight programming languages may not fully represent the diversity and specialized use cases in real-world software development.

data.source: Constructed using human annotators and based on code-related documents and queries.

methodology.calculation: Correctness is calculated by executing generated code against provided test cases, while instruction compliance is checked against specified requirements.
methodology.interpretation: Results are interpreted based on the pass rates for correctness and adherence to instructional constraints.
methodology.baseline_results: Results are tracked and compared across 40+ Language Models in terms of correctness and instruction compliance.
methodology.validation: Extensive experimental results show performance across various models

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark includes multilingual evaluation across different programming languages and their effectiveness in meeting specific constraints.
